intro: Cebatha lonchophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leafed cebatha, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
